definition: signal made with one's eyes/meaningful glance
eye/small hole/crux (of a matter)/CL:隻|只[zhi1],雙|双[shuang1]/classifier for big hollow things (wells, stoves, pots etc)
color/dice
color/CL:種|种[zhong3]/look/appearance/sex
to give sb a meaningful look
to give sb a meaningful look

uveal melanoma
pinyin: yan3 se4 su4 ceng2 hei1 se4 su4 liu2

sentences.english: I'm pretty sure she winked at them, too.
sentences.chinese: 我还很肯定她还向她们使眼色。

sentences.english: She winked at Marisa. "But we could."
sentences.chinese: 她向玛丽斯使了个眼色，“但我们可以。”

sentences.english: In other words, shemaymight try to make eyes at him or give him the eye.
sentences.chinese: 换句话说，她试着给他递眼色或暗送秋波。

sentences.english: Those of black smoke came damp, suddenly, the guy red sad.
sentences.chinese: 羞涩的眼色碰上受潮的烟，倏忽，哀愁的眼孔通红。

sentences.english: He winks at all the girls who pass.
sentences.chinese: 他向所有经过的女孩使眼色。

sentences.english: Maybe I should wink to get her attention.
sentences.chinese: 也许我应该跟她使眼色引起她注意。

sentences.english: I'll tip you the wink when it's safe to come in.
sentences.chinese: 可以安全进来时，我会向你使眼色的。

sentences.english: One glance of recognition, she had imagined, must needs pass between them.
sentences.chinese: 他俩之问需要交换一次彼此心照的眼色。

sentences.english: Father winked at Dick as a sign for him to keep still.
sentences.chinese: 父亲对迪克使了眼色，示意他不要动。

sentences.english: He flashed me a meaning look.
I give her a little wink.
sentences.chinese: 我对她使了个同意的眼色。

sentences.english: She fluttered her eyelashes at him.
She cast a sly glance at her bridge partner.
sentences.chinese: 她向桥牌搭挡使了个会意的眼色。

sentences.english: He opened the door, cocked his eye at me and left.
sentences.chinese: 他打开门，向我使了个眼色，就离去了。

sentences.english: He winked at me to keep silent.
sentences.chinese: 他给我递了个眼色，要我保持沉默。

definition: to give sb a meaningful look

combined ideogram (one of the Six Methods 六書|六书[liu4 shu1] of forming Chinese characters)/Chinese character that combines the meanings of existing elements/also known as joint ideogram or associative compounds/to comprehend without being told explicitly/to cotton on/knowing (smile, glance etc)
to give sb a meaningful look

nutation (plants turning to face the sun)

to hint/to indicate (an idea to sb)
